bibl.title: The Population of Roman Alexandria.

series.title: Transactions and Proceedings of the American Philological Association
TAPA

bibl.note: This study proposes to reassess the ancient evidence for Alexandria as well as modern methodologies of estimating populations of ancient cities and to suggest a reasonable, maximum range for the total population of Alexandria (500.000 - 600.000 persons) during the early Principate. - P. 286: new transcription (by Ludwig Koenen) of P. bibl. univ. Giss. V, 46.
